Body: I am a Republic Wireless subscriber with the Motorola Defy XT. The Defy is a decent phone, but unfortunately very little space has been dedicated to internal application storage (300MB) and often we are running out of space so we are on a quest to get root access to alleviate our issues. Sadly, RW has not provided us with the MLS / SPC code to modify the device.My question is, is there an Android shell command that I can issue that will directly / indirectly test the validity of an MLS / SPC code. In other words, a command that changes a setting that requires the MLS code to be passed along as a parameter.My hope is that I can write a script that will test all possible combinations of the six digit integer.
Title: ADB Shell command that can test MLS / SPC codes?

history.Text: I am a Republic Wireless subscriber with the Motorola Defy XT. The Defy is a decent phone, but unfortunately very little space has been dedicated to internal application storage (300MB) and often we are running out of space so we are on a quest to get root access to alleviate our issues. Sadly, RW has not provided us with the MLS / SPC code to modify the device.My question is, is there an android shell command that I can issue that will directly / indirectly test the validity of an MLS / SPC code. E.g. a command that changes a setting that requires the mls code to be passed along as a parameter.My hope is that I can write a script that will test all possible combinations of the six digit integer.Thanks in advance.Chris
ADB Shell command that can test MLS / SPC codes?
